intro: Bronwenia peckoltii, commonly known as the Peckolt's hakea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, needle-like foliage. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Bronwenia peckoltii is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that is well adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat.
